intro: Carex insulana, commonly known as the island sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves arranged in dense, grass-like clusters. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats. Carex insulana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife.
